alert.note: Alert for Grand Isle (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 16 at 4:21PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Clinton and northwestern Grand Isle Counties through 500 PM EDT... At 420 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Beekmantown, moving north at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Plattsburgh, Chazy, Mooers, Champlain, Isle La Motte, Grand Isle, Rouses Point, Alburgh Village, Alburgh, North Hero, Reed Point, Young Island, Wilcox Point, Colligan Point, Scott Point, Hazen Point, East Beekmantown, Mooney Bay, Wait Bay and Conner Bay. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for northern New York...and northwestern Vermont.
